result.execSummary:
The defendant Wendy R Ronkoski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days, or serve 6 days jail consecutive as penalty for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wendy R Ronkoski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Gerard Francis Kuchler and Attorney Badley Bloch in court.   Defendant Wendy R Ronkoski did not appear.   Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State moves to amend Count #2 to a county ordinance of Possession of Marijuana.  The Court amends the charge and enter a no contest plea and finds the Defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  The Defendant is sentenced as follows: Count #2: 
FINE: $267.50 to be paid in 60 days or serve 6 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.
From Atty Bloch dated 2/25/16 re settlement of case with offer.

Defendant Wendy R Ronkoski in court with attorney Gerard Francis Kuchler.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties advise the Court they are ready to proceed to trial.   The parties are to premark exhibits with the clerk.  The State 1-99 and the Defense starting at 100.  The trial is expected to last one day.
From Atty Bloch dated 2/23/16 re upcoming trial.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Wendy R Ronkoski in court with attorney Gerard Francis Kuchler & Bradley Bloch.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court calls the case to address the Defendant's Motion to Make More Definite and Certain.  Attorney Kuchler addresses the Court.  Intern Pingel addresses the Court. stating the complaint is sufficient and contains all necessary information.  The Court denies the motion for reasons stated on the record.    Attorney Kuchler requests the court set the matter for trial.    Any further discovery demands to be made with the District Attorney's office.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Motion to Make More Definite and Certain.

Defendant Wendy R Ronkoski in court with attorney Bradley Bloch and Attorney Gerard Francis Kuchler.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the motion to dismiss.  Both parties address the Court.  The Court denies the motion for reasons stated on the record.  Attorney Kuchler advises the Court he intends to file another motion.  The motion is to be filed by January 6, 2015 if there will be witnesses involved or January 11, 2015 if no witnesses involved.  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
to dismiss filed by Attorney Gerard Kuchler.

Defendant Wendy R Ronkoski in court with attorney Gerard Francis Kuchler.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kuchler has an offer but is waiting for discovery requesting time to file a moion.  The motion is to be filed by November 23, 2015.  If Attorney Kuchler is not planning on filing a motion he is to notify the court in writing by 11/23/15.  The Court sets the matter for a motion hearing.   Motion hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Wendy R Ronkoski in court.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
